channel.title: data.table on Home
channel.description: Recent content in data.table on Home

item.title: A gentle introduction to data.table
item.description: This post presents a quick introduction to data.table, an indispensable package for data wrangling in R. The main objective is to present the data.table syntax, showing how to perform basic but essential data manipulation tasks.

item.title: A data.table and pandas small stroll
item.description: data.table and pandas are two major libraries for efficient manipulation of data frames in R and Python, respectively. Being quite familiar with data.table, I wrote this post as an exercice to learn more about pandas. Commands to execute common data munging tasks are presented side-by-side to facilitate the comparison.

item.title: Learning Japanese with data.table and ggplot2
item.description: This post is about drawing hiragana and katakana tables using R, data.table, and ggplot2. The objective was to better illustrate the rules that underlie these two Japanese writing systems.

item.title: A data.table and dplyr tour
item.description: data.table and dplyr are two R packages that both aim at an easier and more efficient manipulation of data frames. This article shows how they can be used to execute common data munging tasks. The commands are presented side-by-side to facilitate the comparison.
